Class HDBOfficerControl

Object
ApplicantControl
HDBOfficerControl
public class HDBOfficerControl extends ApplicantControl
Control class for handling all business logic specific to HDB Officers. Extends ApplicantControl to reuse common applicant functionality, while adding features related to project registration, enquiry management, and flat booking for officers.

  • Field Summary

    Repository managing all BTO project data accessible to officers.
    private final Scanner
    sc
    Scanner for reading user input in officer-specific workflows.

  • Constructor Details

    • HDBOfficerControl

      public HDBOfficerControl()

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(ApplicantRepo aRepo, BTOProjectRepo pRepo, HDBOfficerRepo officerRepo)
      Initializes the officer control with access to the applicant, project, and officer repositories. This method must be called from the main application before using any control functionality.
      Parameters:
      aRepo - The applicant repository to be used.
      pRepo - The BTO project repository to be used.
      officerRepo - The officer repository to be used.

    • viewEligibleProjects

      public void viewEligibleProjects(HDBOfficer officer)
      Displays a list of BTO projects the officer is eligible to apply for. Filters out projects the officer is already managing and only shows visible ones. Eligibility is based on marital status and age.
      Parameters:
      officer - The HDB officer viewing eligible projects.

    • handleSubmitApplication

      public void handleSubmitApplication(HDBOfficer officer)
      Handles the process of allowing an HDB officer to apply for a BTO project, ensuring they do not apply to projects they are already managing and that they meet eligibility criteria based on age and marital status. Includes the following checks: - Officer has not already submitted a valid application - The selected project exists, is visible, and is currently active - Officer is not applying to a project they are managing - Officer meets age/marital requirements for flat types - Officer selects a valid flat type for application
      Parameters:
      officer - The HDB officer submitting the application.

    • handleSubmitRegistration

      public void handleSubmitRegistration(HDBOfficer officer)
      Handles the officer's registration to manage a BTO project. Performs several validations: - Officer is not already handling another project - Project exists - Officer has not applied to or already registered for the same project - No existing registration overlaps with the new project's application period If all checks pass, a new officer registration is submitted for approval.
      Parameters:
      officer - The HDB officer attempting to register for a project.

    • handleViewRegistrationStatus

      public void handleViewRegistrationStatus(HDBOfficer officer)
      Displays the status of the officer's current registration, if one exists. Shows the project name, neighborhood, application period, and current approval status.
      Parameters:
      officer - The officer viewing their registration status.

    • viewProjectHandling

      public void viewProjectHandling(HDBOfficer officer)
      Displays the full details of the project currently assigned to the officer. This includes name, neighborhood, application period, visibility, and available flat types with pricing. If the officer is not currently assigned to any project, a message is shown.
      Parameters:
      officer - The officer viewing the project they are managing.

    • viewAndReplyEnquiries

      public void viewAndReplyEnquiries(HDBOfficer officer)
      Displays all enquiries submitted for the project the officer is managing, and allows the officer to reply to one that hasn't been responded to yet. Validates officer assignment, enquiry selection, and reply input.
      Parameters:
      officer - The officer replying to enquiries.

    • handleFlatBooking

      public void handleFlatBooking(HDBOfficer user)
      Handles flat booking for an applicant, ensuring the officer is assigned to the same project the applicant applied for, and that the application status is successful. Also checks if flats are still available before proceeding with the booking.
      Parameters:
      user - The officer performing the flat booking.

    • generateBookingReceipt

      public void generateBookingReceipt(HDBOfficer user)
      Generates and displays a booking receipt for a successfully booked applicant. Validates that the officer is handling the relevant project and that the applicant has a booked application for that project.
      Parameters:
      user - The officer generating the receipt.

    • datesOverlap

      private boolean datesOverlap(LocalDate start1, LocalDate end1, LocalDate start2, LocalDate end2)
      Utility method to check if two date ranges overlap. Used to ensure no conflicting officer registrations across projects.
      Parameters:
      start1 - Start date of the first range.
      end1 - End date of the first range.
      start2 - Start date of the second range.
      end2 - End date of the second range.
      Returns:
      True if the ranges overlap, false otherwise.
